body_html:
For Mac OS X users who still get this issue, the simplest work around I found is to add this line:
backend: TkAgg

in ~/.matplotlib/matplotlibrc

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34977388/matplotlib-runtimeerror-python-is-not-installed-as-a-framework
body_text:
For Mac OS X users who still get this issue, the simplest work around I found is to add this line:
backend: TkAgg
in ~/.matplotlib/matplotlibrc
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34977388/matplotlib-runtimeerror-python-is-not-installed-as-a-framework
body:
For Mac OS X users who still get this issue, the simplest work around I found is to add this line:
`backend: TkAgg`

in ~/.matplotlib/matplotlibrc

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34977388/matplotlib-runtimeerror-python-is-not-installed-as-a-framework
